sentence.Network_en: He patented the idea that the atom could be split.
sentence.Network_cn: 他获得了“原子可以再分”这一概念的专利权。

sentence.Network_en: The government patented the device to its inventor.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府给予发明者专利权.

sentence.Network_en: ICM is an internationally patented call waiting service suited to the domestic market.
sentence.Network_cn: 因特网呼叫管理（ICM）是一项获得国际专利的、适合国内市场需求的呼叫等待服务。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Even more processes are never patented at all but kept as secret processes ., 甚至更多的工艺过程根本就不获得专利 , 而是都作为秘方保存.
non-iron 不用熨烫的patented 获得专利的programmable 可预定程序的
SRI International patented this concept , one of the keys to subsequent artificial - muscle technology ., SRI 为这个概念取得专利 , 后来这个概念也成为人造肌肉的关键技术之一.
introduced and patented by Red Valve , the air-actuated Type A Pinch Valve offers a unique , cost effective solution to flow control problems .美国红阀公司创新开发并拥有专利的气动A型夹管阀为解决流体控制难题提供一个独特的、成本低廉的解决方案。

entry.def: A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

example.ex: P&G applied for a patent on its cookies...
example.tran: 宝洁公司为它的饼干申请专利权。

example.ex: He held a number of patents for his many innovations...
example.tran: 他拥有多项发明的专利权。

entry.def: If you patent something, you obtain a patent for it.

example.ex: He patented the idea that the atom could be split...
example.tran: 他获得了“原子可以再分”这一概念的专利权。

example.ex: The invention has been patented by the university.
example.tran: 那项发明已被那所大学申请了专利。

entry.tran: （尤指坏事物）明显的，显而易见的
entry.def: You use patent to describe something, especially something bad, in order to indicate in an emphatic way that you think its nature or existence is clear and obvious.

means.word_mean: 1. (of devices and processes) protected by patent;

Sentence.sentence: He obtained Monsanto's patented seeds by illegal means.
Monsanto has the right to recover the costs of its patented seeds
In his lifetime, Hutton patented 244 inventions.
